questions.question_text: As an administrator, you would like the ability to see and test upcoming changes to the Google Admin console. How would an admin get access to pre-release features and upcoming ChromeOS device management changes to the Admin console?

choices.B: Join the Chrome Enterprise BETA Testing
choices.C: Register for the Chrome Enterprise Trusted Tester Program
choices.A: Enroll in the ChromeOS Factory Software Platform

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
To get access to pre-release features and upcoming ChromeOS device management changes in the Admin console, registering for the Chrome Enterprise Trusted Tester Program is the best option

questions.question_text: You have a number of applications that you rely upon. You want to ensure that your applications continue to run smoothly with each new version of Chrome. What should you do?

choices.D: Implement a QA strategy and put their IT group and 5% of users on the beta channel of ChromeOS so they can find and report bugs early for upcoming Chrome releases.
choices.C: Always install the latest version of those applications when they become available so they are always compatible with the latest version of Chrome.
choices.A: Ask users to provide feedback on the applications within a week of a new Chrome release.
choices.B: Advise them to take no action. All applications are automatically supported on the latest version of Chrome.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
it's important to have a proactive approach to testing new releases before they are rolled out to all users. The best practice is to implement a Quality Assurance (QA) strategy that includes putting a small group of users (like IT staff or a select group of end users) on the beta channel of ChromeOS. This way, you can catch compatibility issues and bugs with upcoming ChromeOS versions before they are deployed to everyone.

Selected Answer: B
Looks like B fits best.

choices.C: Enable user enrollment to the user OU
choices.D: Use a Go-Box device to enroll devices on delivery
choices.B: Work with the vendor to implement zero-touch enrollment
choices.A: Engage the vendor to manually enroll devices

questions.question_text:
An organization is moving from ChromeOS Flex to Chromebooks. The admin has a purchase of 50,000 devices being delivered that must be set up within two days of delivery.

What is the most efficient way to accomplish this?
After deploying your Android VPN client, you want to enforce always-on VPN. Where is this configured?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
This setting is configured within the Google Admin Console

choices.B: via JSON configuration with the deployed application

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
I’d roll with B — seems solid.

choices.D: In “User and Browser Settings”, under “Chrome Updates”, configure “Relaunch Notifications" to “Force relaunch after a period" and enter a time period in hours
choices.C: Ask Human Resources to create and send out a company memo asking everyone to restart their devices within 24 hours.
choices.B: Manually connect to each device using Chrome Remote Desktop and restart the device. After the device has started, start up the Chrome Browser, go to chrome://help to verify that the update has taken place.
choices.A: In the Admin console, in “Device Settings", under “AutoUpdate Settings”, configure “Device Updates” to “Allow updates”.
